body_html:
Hm, looks fine to me (aside from the 4 spaces intend... 😉 ). This is what I originally meant:

def to_s
  return last_day if start_date == end_date
  elements = base_format
  elements = elements.chomp(' %Y') if start_date.year == end_date.year
  elements = elements.chomp(' %b') if start_date.month == end_date.month
  start_date.strftime(elements) + ' - ' + last_day
end

private

def base_format
  @base_format ||= "%-d %b %Y"
end

def last_day
  end_date.strftime(base_format)
end

But using a constant is of course also a valid solution.

body:
Hm, looks fine to me (aside from the 4 spaces intend... 😉 ). This is what I originally meant:
```ruby
def to_s
  return last_day if start_date == end_date
  elements = base_format
  elements = elements.chomp(' %Y') if start_date.year == end_date.year
  elements = elements.chomp(' %b') if start_date.month == end_date.month
  start_date.strftime(elements) + ' - ' + last_day
end

private

def base_format
  @base_format ||= "%-d %b %Y"
end

def last_day
  end_date.strftime(base_format)
end
```

But using a constant is of course also a valid solution.
